Literature Review: Zika virus (ZIKV) is an emerging virus from the Flaviviridae family that has gained significant attention in recent years due to its potential to cause devastating consequences during pregnancy. The pathogenesis of ZIKV infection is complex and involves multiple mechanisms that enable the virus to replicate efficiently and evade the host immune response. This review aims to discuss recent reports on the mechanisms used by ZIKV to replicate and the potential new areas of research for the development of therapeutic approaches.
